adddependencies.name: adddependencies
adddependencies.description: Adds the missing dependencies to the manifest file.

options.name: all
options.description: Add all missing dependencies to the SuiteCloud project. When specified, ensure that you do not use the -feature, -file, and -object options.

options.name: feature
options.description: Specify the feature dependency references to add to the project. Each reference is a name:value pair that is delimited by a space. For example, CUSTOMRECORD:required. When specified, ensure that you do not use the -all option.

options.name: file
options.description: Specify the files to add to the project. When specified, ensure that you do not use the -all option.

options.name: object
options.description: Specify the object script IDs to add to the project. When specified, ensure that you do not use the -all option.

options.name: project
options.description: Set the folder or zipped file containing the project. It overrides the default project.

options.name: url
options.description: Specify the domain URL. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: email
options.description: Specify your email address. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: account
options.description: Specify your account ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: role
options.description: Specify the role ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: authid
options.description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination. When you use this option in a command execution, you should not specify any of the following options: -email, -account, -url, or -role.

createproject.name: createproject
createproject.description: Creates a SuiteCloud project, either a SuiteApp or an account customization project (ACP).

options.name: parentdirectory
options.description: Set the parent folder where to create the project.

options.name: overwrite
options.description: Overwrite the existing project.

options.name: type
options.description: Specify the project type.

options.name: projectname
options.description: Specify the project name.

options.name: publisherid
options.description: Specify the publisher ID. It is mandatory for SuiteApps.

options.name: projectid
options.description: Specify the project ID. It is mandatory for SuiteApps.

options.name: projectversion
options.description: Specify the project version. It is mandatory for SuiteApps.

deploy.name: deploy
deploy.description: Deploys the folder containing the project. The project folder is zipped before deployment, only including the files and folders referenced in the deploy.xml file.

options.name: log
options.description: Sets the deployment log file location, as either a directory or a file name. If it is a directory, a default log file is generated in the specified location. If a log file already exists in the specified location, deployment log details are appended to that existing file.

options.name: validate
options.description: Validate the project before deploying. If an error ocurrs during the deployment, the process is stopped.

options.name: no_preview
options.description: Skip the preview step.

options.name: skip_warning
options.description: Indicates that the warning before deployment to production account will be skipped.

options.name: applycontentprotection
options.description: Apply the content protection settings from the hiding.xml and locking.xml files. It only applies to SuiteApps.

options.name: accountspecificvalues
options.description: Indicate how to handle the presence of account-specific values in an account customization project. If there are account-specific values in the project, enter WARNING to continue with the deployment process, or ERROR to stop it. If the option is not specified, the default value is ERROR. It only applies to account customization projects.

options.name: project
options.description: Set the folder or zipped file containing the project. It overrides the default project.

options.name: url
options.description: Specify the domain URL. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: email
options.description: Specify your email address. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: account
options.description: Specify your account ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: role
options.description: Specify the role ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: authid
options.description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination. When you use this option in a command execution, you should not specify any of the following options: -email, -account, -url, or -role.

importfiles.name: importfiles
importfiles.description: Imports files from an account to your account customization project. You cannot import files from a SuiteApp.

options.name: paths
options.description: Specify the File Cabinet paths of the files to import. For example, "/SuiteScripts".

options.name: excludeproperties
options.description: Exclude all file properties within the .attributes folder.

options.name: project
options.description: Set the folder or zipped file containing the project. It overrides the default project.

options.name: url
options.description: Specify the domain URL. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: email
options.description: Specify your email address. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: account
options.description: Specify your account ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: role
options.description: Specify the role ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: authid
options.description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination. When you use this option in a command execution, you should not specify any of the following options: -email, -account, -url, or -role.

importobjects.name: importobjects
importobjects.description: Imports custom objects from your NetSuite account to the SDF project. In account customization projects (ACP), if SuiteScript files are referenced in the custom objects you import, these files get imported by default.

options.name: appid
options.description: Specify your application ID. If specified, only custom objects with that application ID are imported. Otherwise, only custom objects with no application ID are imported.

options.name: scriptid
options.description: Specify the script ID. To specify multiple IDs, enter the IDs separated by spaces. Enter "ALL" to import all custom objects of the specified type.

options.name: type
options.description: Specify the type of custom objects to import. Enter "ALL" to import all custom objects. To see what custom objects are supported by SDF, see https://system.netsuite.com/app/help/helpcenter.nl?fid=sdfxml.html.

options.name: destinationfolder
options.description: Specify the project folder where objects will be stored. It must be within the Objects folder of your project. For example, /Objects/MyObjects.

options.name: excludefiles
options.description: Indicates that the SuiteScript files referenced in custom objects are not imported. It can only be used in account customization projects (ACP).

options.name: project
options.description: Set the folder or zipped file containing the project. It overrides the default project.

options.name: url
options.description: Specify the domain URL. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: email
options.description: Specify your email address. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: account
options.description: Specify your account ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: role
options.description: Specify the role ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: authid
options.description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination. When you use this option in a command execution, you should not specify any of the following options: -email, -account, -url, or -role.

listfiles.name: listfiles
listfiles.description: Lists the files in the File Cabinet of your account.

options.name: folder
options.description: Specify the File Cabinet path, for example, "/SuiteScripts". All files within subfolders are included.

options.name: url
options.description: Specify the domain URL. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: email
options.description: Specify your email address. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: account
options.description: Specify your account ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: role
options.description: Specify the role ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: authid
options.description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination. When you use this option in a command execution, you should not specify any of the following options: -email, -account, -url, or -role.

listobjects.name: listobjects
listobjects.description: Lists the custom objects deployed in an account.

options.name: appid
options.description: Specify your application ID. If specified, only custom objects with that application ID are listed. Otherwise, only custom objects with no application ID are listed.

options.name: scriptid
options.description: Specify the script ID. If you specify it, only objects containing that script ID will be listed. Otherwise, all objects are listed.

options.name: type
options.description: Specify the type of custom objects to list. To specify multiple types, enter the types separated by spaces. Otherwise, all types are listed. To see what custom objects are supported by SDF, see https://system.netsuite.com/app/help/helpcenter.nl?fid=sdfxml.html.

options.name: url
options.description: Specify the domain URL. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: email
options.description: Specify your email address. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: account
options.description: Specify your account ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: role
options.description: Specify the role ID. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: authid
options.description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination. When you use this option in a command execution, you should not specify any of the following options: -email, -account, -url, or -role.

update.name: update
update.description: Overwrites the custom objects in the project with the custom objects in an account.

options.name: scriptid
options.description: Specify the script ID of the objects you want to overwrite.

options.name: project
options.description: Set the folder or zipped file containing the project. It overrides the default project.

options.name: url
options.description: Specify the domain URL. It overrides the SDF file settings.

options.name: authid
options.description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination. When you use this option in a command execution, you should not specify any of the following options: -email, -account, -url, or -role.

validate.name: validate
validate.description: Validates the folder containing the SuiteCloud project.

options.name: log
options.description: Sets the validation log file location, as either a directory or a file name. If it is a directory, a default log file is generated in the specified location. If a log file already exists in the specified location, validation log details are appended to that existing file.

options.name: server
options.description: Indicates that the server will perform the validation.

options.name: applycontentprotection
options.description: Apply the content protection settings from the hiding.xml and locking.xml files. It only applies to SuiteApps.

options.name: accountspecificvalues
options.description: Indicate how to handle the presence of account-specific values in an account customization project. If there are account-specific values in the project, enter WARNING to continue with the deployment process, or ERROR to stop it. If the option is not specified, the default value is ERROR. It only applies to account customization projects.
